alert.note: Alert for Deltana and Tanana Flats; Middle Tanana Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 12 at 3:43PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive snow melt and rainfall is expected along the Tanana River. * WHERE...The Tanana River from Delta Junction downstream to Bonanza Creek, including the following areas, Deltana and Tanana Flats and Middle Tanana Valley. This includes Whitestone Farms, Salcha, and Rosie Creek Subdivision. * WHEN...Until 315 PM AKDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding is expected over low-lying areas along the Tanana River, and along old sloughs near the river. Flooding is expected at Whitestone Farms, where water rising on Wednesday could flood some buildings. Flooding is expected at the Rosie Creek Subdivision near Fairbanks, where water levels are expected to rise through Wednesday and flood Perkins Drive and Melanie Lane. Flooding in the Rosie Creek area is expected to be about 1 ft lower than what occurred in 2020. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 343 PM AKDT, High water on the Tanana River, combined with heavy rain that occurred south of Salcha on Sunday night and Monday, and additional rain expected on Wednesday, is expected to cause minor flooding along the Tanana River. Water levels are now bankfull and are expected to rise through Wednesday and remain high through the weekend. Water levels near Delta Junction are expected to fall late this week. Tanana river gage readings at Delta Junction were near minor flood stage today, are falling this afternoon and tonight, and are expected to rise again on Wednesday, cresting 6 inches above flood stage. Tanana River gage readings at Fairbanks are at bankfull and expected to rise through Wednesday, and crest just above flood stage on Wednesday. Water is expected remain high near Fairbanks through the weekend. - For Tanana River at Big Delta: At 2:55pm the stage was 21.79 feet. Flood Stage is 23.0 feet. Forecast: A crest around 23.8 feet is expected around 4:00pm Wednesday. - For Chena River at Fairbanks: At 2:15pm the stage was 1.79 feet. Flood Stage is 12.0 feet. Forecast: A crest around 1.9 feet is expected around 4:00pm Wednesday. - For Salcha River near Salchaket: At 3:00pm the stage was 8.86 feet. Flood Stage is 15.0 feet. Forecast: A crest around 8.9 feet is expected around 10:00pm Wednesday. - For Tanana River at Fairbanks: At 2:15pm the stage was 23.77 feet. Flood Stage is 24.5 feet. Forecast: A crest around 24.7 feet is expected around 4:00am Thursday. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.

area.areaDesc: Deltana and Tanana Flats; Middle Tanana Valley
